text: Edwin Piper Cox (May 2, 1870 – March 11, 1938) was a Virginia politician. He represented Richmond in the Virginia House of Delegates, and served as that body's Speaker from 1914 until 1916. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Members of the Virginia House of Delegates Category:Speakers of the Virginia House of Delegates Category:Politicians from Richmond, Virginia Category:1870 births Category:1938 deaths Category:Virginia Democrats Category:People from Chesterfield County, Virginia Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Edwin P. Cox
